title: Lynda - Illustrator CC for Web Design: Wireframing with Justin S
description:
Lynda - Illustrator CC for Web Design: Wireframing with Justin Seeley 

Subjects:  Design Web 
Software:  Illustrator 

2h 0m Intermediate Feb 25, 2015  | Uploaded in Mar 5, 2015 by 2boweb


Illustrator's libraries and symbols make it a great program for developing detailed wireframes for your design ideas. In this installment of Illustrator CC for Web Design, Justin Seeley walks through everything to know about creating, using, and saving wireframes in Illustrator. Starting with a carefully chosen color scheme, Justin shows how to structure a wireframe in layers, develop templates for different devices, and create a library of ready-to-use UI elements, including multistate buttons and placeholders for media and forms. He then combines these elements in an example wireframe, and shows how to save versions of your file as the design evolves.Ã¢â‚¬Â¨Ã¢â‚¬Â¨

Miss part one? Check out Illustrator CC for Web Design: Core Concepts.

	Ã¢â‚¬Â¢	Assembling your wireframe
	Ã¢â‚¬Â¢	Saving and versioning a wireframe
